title: Phoebe Waller-Bridge Speaks Uncomfortable Truths in SNL Opening Monologue
text:
Phoebe Waller-Bridge talks Fleabag, Killing Eve, and the Hot Priest Hornstorm. 🙏 #SNL pic.twitter.com/EBuu0xgZHy — Saturday Night Live - SNL (@nbcsnl) October 6, 2019

Winner of both our hearts and multiple Emmy’s, Phoebe Waller-Bridge spared no uncomfortable topic tonight in her SNL monologue. The first-time host covered a range of subject manner spanning sex addiction, women’s needs, and the ever-present reality of human genitalia. On psychopaths: “They’re really having a moment, aren’t they?” On why Hot Priest was hot: “Because he was doing this one thing: listening.” On people’s genitals: “They’re just sitting there.” One can only imagine the countless children up past their bedtimes watching SNL, blessed with this new knowledge about feminism, politics, and the human body. Waller-Bridge is doubtless shaping the next generation, and we are better for it.
description: Phoebe Waller-Bridge delivered her SNL monologue spanning feminism, human biology, psychology, and her TV show Fleabag.
